New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit four home runs in the first inning, including a career-high 47th, and the Dodgers set a record with four home runs in an inning; Shohei Ohtani became the first player to reach 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a season
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani sparked a five-run first inning with four home runs; Tommy Edman hit two home runs, including a two-run shot from both sides of the plate; Will Smith, Max Muncy, and Edman hit back-to-back-to-back home runs; The Dodgers avoided a three-game sweep and improved their division lead; The game ended with a 10-8 Dodgers victory
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts praised the team's resilience and the energy in the dugout; Shohei Ohtani's pursuit of a 50-50 season was noted
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game's outcome was crucial for the Dodgers' playoff push; The crowd's reactions to Shohei Ohtani's performance were mentioned
